byline.contributor: Steven Lee Myers contributed reporting from Washington, and a New York Times employee from Damascus, Syria.

abstract: American ambassador to Damascus Robert S Ford, who has been outspoken in criticizing Syria's crackdown on popular protests, leaves country because of threats to his safety; his departure prompts Syria to withdraw its own ambassador Imad Moustapha from Washington.
snippet: Robert S. Ford left the country after receiving “credible threats against his personal safety,” embassy officials said.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )

lead_paragraph: Robert S. Ford left the country after receiving “credible threats against his personal safety,” embassy officials said.

headline.main: U.S. Ambassador to Syria Leaves Damascus Amid Threats to Safety
headline.print_headline: U.S. Ambassador Leaves Syria Amid Threats
headline.seo: Ambassador Robert Ford Leaves Syria Amid Threats
